shows.title: Thunderbirds
shows.desc: In the year 2065, the Tracy family run International Rescue - a top-secret organization whose ongoing mission is to rescue people trapped in extraordinarily dangerous situations using their advanced Thunderbirds machines.

shows.title: Blackadder
shows.desc: In the Middle Ages, Prince Edmund the Black Adder constantly schemes and endeavors to seize the crown from his father and brother.

shows.title: Fawlty Towers
shows.desc: Hotel owner Basil Fawlty's incompetence, short fuse, and arrogance form a combination that ensures accidents and trouble are never far away.

shows.title: Keeping Up Appearances
shows.desc: A snobbish housewife is determined to climb the social ladder, in spite of her family's working class connections and the constant chagrin of her long suffering husband.

shows.title: Monty Python
shows.desc: The original surreal sketch comedy showcase for the Monty Python troupe.

shows.title: Mr. Bean
shows.desc: Bumbling, childlike Mr. Bean has trouble completing the simplest of day-to-day tasks, but his perseverance and resourcefulness frequently allow him to find ingenious ways around problems.

shows.title: Red Dwarf
shows.desc: The adventures of the last human alive and his friends, stranded 3 million years into deep space on the mining ship Red Dwarf.

shows.title: Ripping Yarns
shows.desc: This show is a collection of tales that make for "ripping good" television. Sir Michael Palin played a different lead character in each yarn.

shows.title: The Benny Hill Show
shows.desc: A skit based show with Benny Hill, often containing smutty humour.

shows.title: Yes Minister
shows.desc: The Right Honorable James Hacker has landed the plum job of Cabinet Minister to the Department of Administration. At last he is in a position of power and can carry out some long-needed reforms, or so he thinks.

shows.title: Charlie Chalk
shows.desc: A clown named Charlie Chalk arrives on the island of Merrytwit after falling asleep on his boat. He befriends the inhabitants of the island and gets into many adventures.

shows.title: Thomas and Friends
shows.desc: This series follows the adventures of Thomas the Tank Engine and all of his engine friends on the Island of Sodor.

shows.title: Midsomer Murders Season 1
shows.desc: A veteran Detective Chief Inspector and his young Sergeant investigate murders around the regional community of Midsomer County.

shows.title: Midsomer Murders Season 2
shows.desc: A veteran Detective Chief Inspector and his young Sergeant investigate murders around the regional community of Midsomer County.

shows.title: Midsomer Murders Season 3
shows.desc: A veteran Detective Chief Inspector and his young Sergeant investigate murders around the regional community of Midsomer County.

shows.title: Miss Marple
shows.desc: Miss Marple, an elderly woman and amateur detective whose sharp mind helps her solve a series of seemingly baffling cases.

shows.title: Poirot
shows.desc: Hercule Poirot, a Belgian detective, has an impeccable knack for getting embroiled in a mystery and solving crimes.

shows.title: Sherlock (2010)
shows.desc: The quirky spin on Conan Doyle's iconic sleuth pitches him as a "high-functioning sociopath" in modern-day London. Assisting him in his investigations: Afghanistan War vet John Watson, who's introduced to Holmes by a mutual acquaintance.

shows.title: Doctor Who (1963)
shows.desc: The adventures of 'The Doctor', a Time Lord who changes appearance and personality by regenerating when near death.

shows.title: Doctor Who (2005) Series 1
shows.desc: Continuing on from Doctor Who (1963), this revival follows the further adventures of the Doctor and their companions as they encounter various alien threats and save civilizations on different planets and time periods.

shows.title: Doctor Who (2005) Series 2
shows.desc: Continuing on from Doctor Who (1963), this revival follows the further adventures of the Doctor and their companions as they encounter various alien threats and save civilizations on different planets and time periods.

shows.title: Space 1999 Series 1
shows.desc: Follows the crew of Moonbase Alpha who struggle to survive when a massive explosion throws the Moon from Earths orbit and out into deep space.

shows.title: Space 1999 Series 2
shows.desc: Follows the crew of Moonbase Alpha who struggle to survive when a massive explosion throws the Moon from Earths orbit and out into deep space.

shows.title: UFO
shows.desc: In 1980, the Supreme Headquarters Alien Defence Organization covertly defends Earth against threats from a dying extraterrestrial race that needs to harvest human organs to survive.

shows.title: The Young Ones
shows.desc: The crazy and sometimes surreal comedic adventures of four very different students in Thatcher's Britain.

shows.title: Father Ted
shows.desc: Three misfit priests and their housekeeper live on Craggy Island, not the peaceful and quiet part of Ireland that it seems to be.

shows.title: The Vicar of Dibley
shows.desc: A boisterous female minister comes to serve in an eccentrically conservative village's church.

shows.title: Noddy Goes To Toyland
shows.desc: While on his Bicycle. Mister Big ears encounters, a new arrival to the land of Toys. And helps him get settled. But is this newcomer really a toy?

shows.title: The Wombles
shows.desc: The misadventures of a fantasy folk community dedicated to cleaning up litter and putting it to their own use.

shows.title: World of Peter Rabbit & Friends
shows.desc: An animated series, telling the story of many beloved Beatrix Potter characters.

shows.title: Enchanted World of Brambly Hedge
shows.desc: The enchanting tales of a community of field mice living in secret in a brambly hedgerow.

shows.title: Little Miss
shows.desc: The adventures of the Little Miss characters created by Roger Hargreaves as female counterparts to the original Mr Men. The personality and appearance of each character matches their name.

shows.title: Mr. Men
shows.desc: Follows brightly colored characters that live in Misterland. All of them have names like Mr Happy, Mr Clumsy and Mr Greedy and their appearance and personality match their name.

shows.title: 'Allo 'Allo
shows.desc: In France during World War II, René Artois runs a small café where Resistance fighters, Gestapo men, German Army officers and escaped Allied POWs interact daily, ignorant of one another's true identity or presence, exasperating René.

shows.title: Dads Army
shows.desc: A ragtag group of Home Guard volunteers prepare for an imminent German invasion during World War II.

shows.title: Mrs. Browns Boys
shows.desc: A comedy centered on a loud-mouthed Irish matriarch whose favorite pastime is meddling in the lives of her six children.

shows.title: French and Saunders
shows.desc: Comedy duo Dawn French and Jennifer Saunders satirically present aspects of British life, films such as Batman Forever and Pulp Fiction.

shows.title: Rumpole Of The Bailey
shows.desc: The cases of a portly and eccentric criminal law barrister.

shows.title: Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy
shows.desc: Arthur Dent and his friend, Ford Prefect, escape the destruction of Earth, only to face incredible trials, tribulations and adventures in space and time.

shows.title: Two Fat Ladies
shows.desc: Clarissa and Jennifer are two long-time friends who enjoy driving on their motorcycle and cooking ethnic foods according to where they live.

shows.title: Pie in the Sky
shows.desc: After a botched sting operation, and denied his imminent retirement, DI Crabbe is suspended from the police and opens his own restaurant. However, his ex-boss, Assistant Chief Constable Freddy Fisher, constantly calls him back on duty.

shows.title: Black Books
shows.desc: Bernard Black runs a book shop, though his customer service skills leave something to be desired. He hires Manny as an employee. Fran runs the shop next door. Between the three of them many adventures ensue.

shows.title: Last Of The Summer Wine
shows.desc: Three old men from Yorkshire who have never grown up face the trials of their fellow town citizens and everyday life and stay young by reminiscing about the days of their youth and attempting feats not common to the elderly.
